page.title: 01Greenhow Moor Yorkshire
page.content: Open space is the main feature of Greenhow with views over endless distance of hills on all sides. Few houses and farms are widely scattered over high bleakly exposed inhospitable moorland ridge. Land is unproductive only supporting few sheep and young cattle. The only employer is a small quarry deveastating the landscape. Farmhouses, derelict for years, now fetch high prices, a new populatin of professional people are moving in. Much money is needed to lay miles of waterpipes, vehicle access etc. Local individual craftsmen help owners do rebuilding to high standard taking years to complete. Skill and Mod-cons can make these comfortable homes but all life is dominated by extremes of weather. It takes tough spirit to live here and people have ruggedly independent character.
